packageMeta.name: purescript-eth-core
packageMeta.description: Core types and utils module for ethereum

declarations.comments:
The number of unique digits (including zero) used to represent integers in
a specific base.
declarations.title: Radix

declarations.comments: The base-16 system.
declarations.title: hexadecimal

declarations.comments:
Convert a `Number` to an `Int`, by taking the closest integer equal to or
less than the argument. Values outside the `Int` range are clamped, `NaN`
and `Infinity` values return 0.
declarations.title: floor

declarations.comments: The base-10 system.
declarations.title: decimal

declarations.comments: The base-2 system.
declarations.title: binary

declarations.comments: Large Integer, needed for handling numbers of up to 32 bytes
declarations.title: BigNumber

declarations.comments: Exponentiate a `BigNumber`
declarations.title: pow

declarations.comments: Convert a Big number into a string in the given base
declarations.title: toString

declarations.comments: Convert a string in the given base to a `BigNumber`
declarations.title: parseBigNumber

declarations.comments: Take the twos complement of a `BigNumer`
declarations.title: toTwosComplement

declarations.comments: Unsafely coerce a BigNumber to an Int.
declarations.title: unsafeToInt

declarations.comments: Take the integer part of a big number
declarations.title: floorBigNumber

declarations.comments: Represents values that can be either positive or negative.
declarations.title: Signed

declarations.comments: Represents a base16, utf8 encoded bytestring
declarations.title: HexString

declarations.comments: Coerce a value into a positive signed value
declarations.title: asSigned

declarations.comments: Compute the length of the hex string, which is twice the number of bytes it represents
declarations.title: hexLength

declarations.comments:
Utils
Computes the number of 0s needed to pad a bytestring of the input length
declarations.title: getPadLength

declarations.comments: Pad a `Signed HexString` on the left until it has length == 0 mod 64.
declarations.title: padLeftSigned

declarations.comments: Pad a `HexString` on the left with '0's until it has length == 0 mod 64.
declarations.title: padLeft

declarations.comments: Pad a `Signed HexString` on the right until it has length 0 mod 64.
declarations.title: padRightSigned

declarations.comments: Pad a `HexString` on the right with 0's until it has length 0 mod 64.
declarations.title: padRight

declarations.comments:
Takes a hex string and produces the corresponding UTF8-decoded string.
This breaks at the first null octet, following the web3 function `toUft8`.
declarations.title: toUtf8

declarations.comments: Get the 'HexString' corresponding to the UTF8 encoding.
declarations.title: fromUtf8

declarations.comments: Takes a hex string and produces the corresponding ASCII decoded string.
declarations.title: toAscii

declarations.comments: Get the 'HexString' corresponding to the ASCII encoding.
declarations.title: fromAscii

declarations.comments:
A class for things which you can hash. Mostly used as a utility for calculating selectors and
event topics
declarations.title: Keccak256

declarations.comments: convert a string representing a type signature into a selector
declarations.title: toSelector

declarations.comments: Opaque PrivateKey type
declarations.title: PrivateKey

declarations.comments: Opaque PublicKey type
declarations.title: PublicKey

declarations.comments: Get the underlying `HexString` representation of a PublicKey.
declarations.title: unPublicKey

declarations.comments: Attempt to construct a PublicKey from a HexString
declarations.title: mkPublicKey

declarations.comments: Get the underlying `HexString` representation of a PrivateKey
declarations.title: unPrivateKey

declarations.comments: Represents and Ethereum address, which is a 20 byte `HexString`
declarations.title: Address

declarations.comments: Produce the `PublicKey` for the corresponding `PrivateKey`.
declarations.title: privateToPublic

declarations.comments: Produce the `Address` corresponding to the `PrivateKey`.
declarations.title: privateToAddress

declarations.comments: Produce the `Address` corresponding to the `PublicKey`
declarations.title: publicToAddress

declarations.comments: Sign the message with a `PrivateKey`
declarations.title: signMessage

declarations.comments: Recover the sender of the message from the `Signature`.
declarations.title: recoverSender

declarations.comments: Used in Ethereum to prevent replay attacks
declarations.title: ChainId

declarations.comments: Add the ChainId offset to the `Signature` `v` parameter.
declarations.title: addChainIdOffset

declarations.comments: Remove the ChainId offset from the `Signature` `v` parameter.
declarations.title: removeChainIdOffset

declarations.comments: Large Integer, needed for handling numbers of up to 32 bytes
declarations.title: BigNumber

declarations.comments: Represents a base16, utf8 encoded bytestring
declarations.title: HexString

declarations.comments: Represents and Ethereum address, which is a 20 byte `HexString`
declarations.title: Address
